title: Poker & Card Terms
description: Put your poker face on and test your card game vocabulary!

questions.question: In poker, what does it mean to 'bluff'?
options: To reveal your hand early
To call every bet regardless of cards
To fold a winning hand
To bet aggressively with a weak hand to make opponents fold
questions.explanation: Bluffing is betting or raising with a weak hand to convince opponents you have a strong hand, causing them to fold superior hands.

questions.question: In poker, what is the 'flop'?
options: A bad hand
The final card dealt
A failed bluff attempt
The first three community cards dealt face up in Texas Hold'em
questions.explanation: The flop is the first three community cards dealt face up in Texas Hold'em and Omaha poker, following the first round of betting.

questions.question: What is a 'full house' in poker?
options: Three of a kind plus a pair
All players still in the hand
Five cards of the same suit
Five consecutive cards
questions.explanation: A full house is a poker hand consisting of three cards of one rank and two cards of another rank, such as three Kings and two Sevens.

questions.question: In poker, what does 'going all-in' mean?
options: Playing every hand in a session
Betting all of your remaining chips on a single hand
Entering every tournament available
Joining a new table
questions.explanation: Going all-in means wagering all of your remaining chips on the current hand. If you lose, you are eliminated; if you win, you double up or more.

questions.question: What is the 'river' in Texas Hold'em poker?
options: The line of chips in the pot
The discard pile
The first card dealt to each player
The fifth and final community card
questions.explanation: The river is the fifth and final community card dealt in Texas Hold'em, following the flop (three cards) and the turn (fourth card).

questions.question: In poker, what is a 'tell'?
options: A scoring method
A rule violation
An announcement of your hand
A subconscious behavior that reveals information about a player's hand
questions.explanation: A tell is an unconscious action, behavior, or habit that gives away information about the strength of a player's hand, such as nervous fidgeting or a change in posture.

questions.question: What does 'the nuts' mean in poker?
options: A terrible hand
The chips in the center of the table
The best possible hand given the community cards
A mandatory bet
questions.explanation: 'The nuts' refers to the best possible hand at any given point in a poker game, based on the community cards showing.

questions.question: In poker, what is a 'bad beat'?
options: Playing poorly throughout a session
A penalty for slow play
Losing a hand despite having been a strong statistical favorite
Being dealt bad cards all night
questions.explanation: A bad beat occurs when a player with a statistically strong hand loses to an opponent who made a lucky draw, often against the odds.

questions.question: What are 'blinds' in poker?
options: Cards dealt face down
Decorative covers for the card deck
Mandatory bets posted before cards are dealt
Players who cannot see their cards
questions.explanation: Blinds are forced bets placed by two players before any cards are dealt, consisting of the small blind and big blind, used to create action and build the pot.

questions.question: In poker, what does it mean to 'check-raise'?
options: Checking your cards then raising your seat
Raising the blinds between hands
Checking for marked cards
Initially checking and then raising after an opponent bets
questions.explanation: A check-raise is a deceptive play where a player first checks (passes) and then raises after an opponent bets, often used to trap opponents into committing more chips.

questions.question: What is a 'straight flush' in poker?
options: Five cards of the same suit in sequence
Four cards of the same rank
Three pairs in one hand
Five cards in sequence of different suits
questions.explanation: A straight flush is five consecutive cards all of the same suit, such as 5-6-7-8-9 of hearts. It is the second-highest hand, below a royal flush.

questions.question: In poker, what does 'on tilt' mean?
options: Leaning back in your chair
Playing emotionally and making poor decisions after a bad hand
Having an unbeatable winning streak
Tilting your cards so opponents can see them
questions.explanation: Being 'on tilt' means a player is making irrational, emotional decisions, usually triggered by frustration from a bad beat or losing streak.

questions.question: What is the 'ante' in poker?
options: The opening card in a hand
A small forced bet that all players must post before a hand
The player to the left of the dealer
The anti-cheating device
questions.explanation: An ante is a small mandatory bet that every player at the table must contribute before a hand is dealt, ensuring there is always something in the pot to play for.

questions.question: In poker, what is a 'pocket pair'?
options: Two cards hidden in your pocket
Two pairs showing on the board
A pair of jokers
Two hole cards of the same rank dealt to a player
questions.explanation: A pocket pair refers to being dealt two hole cards (private cards) of the same rank, such as two Queens or two Fives.

questions.question: What does 'muck' mean in poker?
options: To clean the table
To shuffle the deck
To split the pot
To discard or fold your hand without showing it
questions.explanation: To muck means to fold and discard your hand face down without revealing your cards. The muck is also the pile of discarded cards.
